intro: Ptilotus decipiens, commonly known as the "false sandbur," is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, spiny seed pods that resemble small burrs. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained sandy soils. Its flowers are small and usually greenish-white, and it is known for its ability to withstand drought conditions. Ptilotus decipiens is often found in coastal and inland dunes, contributing to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
